member.name: T:ComponentPro.Net.SspiAuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Defines SSPI authentication methods used for logging in the user account on the server.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.SspiAuthenticationMethod.NTLM
member.summary: Secure SASL NTLM authentication (also known as Secure Password Authentication - SPA). In Windows domain environment such as Active Directory, can also be used to authenticate the current Windows user (in this case, the developer should pass a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) as user name and password values). Might not be supported by particular server implementations.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.SspiAuthenticationMethod.Kerberos
member.summary: Secure SASL GSSAPI authentication (Kerberos). Used to authenticate the current Windows user in Windows domain environment such as Active Directory. User name and password values will be ignored and can be left blank or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic). Might not be supported by particular server implementations.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Net.SspiAuthenticationMethod.Negotiate
member.summary: Negotiate authentication.

member.name: P:c_APA.c_PAA
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out.
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is -1 (infinite).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server.
The property only affects synchronous methods.
Minimal value is 500. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_HD
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_U8A
member.summary: Do not cache any sessions.
member.remarks: Mostly useful for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_QDB
member.summary: Do not shutdown and close the underlying socket after sending or receiving fatal alert or close notify.
member.remarks: Protocols like FTP use this feature.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_Q2A
member.summary: Do not send empty record after sucessful handshake with CBC ciphers.
member.remarks: For compatibility with broken implementations.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_S8A
member.summary: Ignore the client version in premaster secret. This only affects server sockets.
member.remarks: For compatibility with broken client implementations.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_S4A
member.summary: Forces the method to do immediate unprotect without exchange of CloseNotify alert messages. This is in violation of the RFC, but some broken servers need it, unfortunately.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_RDB
member.summary: This option is currently unused.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_R4A
member.summary: Causes an exception not to be thrown when a socket is closed by the server during negotiation. Instead, the negotiation will appear as successful, followed by an immediate socket closure.
member.remarks: This is needed by Serv-U FTP server that behaves like this when downloading an empty file or directory listing. Even though this behavior is almost certainly bad and could pose a potential security threat, we have to enable this option for this server to be able to work with it.

member.name: F:c_M2A.c_U4A
member.summary: Forces the method to do immediate close without exchange of CloseNotify alert messages. This is in violation of the RFC, but some broken servers (IIS with TLS 1.1) need it, unfortunately.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SecureShellConnection.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server. This also means that data transfers only time out after x milliseconds of inactivity, not after x milliseconds from the start of the transfer.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:ComponentPro.Net.SecureShellConnection.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is connected.

remarks.p: This property returns the latest known state of the session. When it returns false, the session was either never connected, or no longer connected. When it returns true, the session was connected at the time of the last I/O operation.
Note: There is no guarantee that the session is still connected even though returns true.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.SecureShellPrivateKey.Save(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Saves the private key into the supplied stream in Base64-encoded PKCS #8 format.
member.param: A stream to which to save the private key.
Password to encrypted the private key, or null if no encryption desired.
The algorithm to use for encryption. Ignored if password is null. Null defaults to "3DES".
member.remarks:
The encryptionAlgorithm can accepts a String or a Type. Currently, the following strings and types are accepted:
TripleDES: null, "3DES", "TripleDES", "1.2.840.113549.3.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES)
DES: "DES", "1.3.14.3.2.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.DES)
RC2: "RC2", "1.2.840.113549.3.2", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.RC2)
To save the key in PuTTY format, pass the "putty" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.
To save the key on OpenSSH/OpenSSL SSLeay format, pass the "ssleay" or "openssh" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.

member.name: M:ComponentPro.Net.SecureShellPrivateKey.Save(System.String,System.String,System.Object)

member.param: A path to stream to which to save the private key.

DES: "DES", "1.3.14.3.2.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.DES)
RC2: "RC2", "1.2.840.113549.3.2", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.RC2)
To save the key in PuTTY format, pass the "putty" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.
To save the key on OpenSSH/OpenSSL SSLeay format, pass the "ssleay" or "openssh" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.

member.name: M:c_F6B.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed. If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: If true, is called by IDisposable.Dispose. Otherwise it is called by finalizer.

digest-challenge = 1#( realm | nonce | qop-options | stale | maxbuf | charset algorithm | cipher-opts | auth-param ) realm = "realm" "=" " realm-value " realm-value = qdstr-val nonce = "nonce" "=" "nonce-value " nonce-value = qdstr-val qop-options = "qop" "=" " qop-list " qop-list = 1#qop-value qop-value = "auth" | "auth-int" | "auth-conf" | token stale = "stale" "=" "true" maxbuf = "maxbuf" "=" maxbuf-value maxbuf-value = 1*DIGIT charset = "charset" "=" "utf-8" algorithm = "algorithm" "=" "md5-sess" cipher-opts = "cipher" "=" "1#cipher-value" cipher-value = "3des" | "des" | "rc4-40" | "rc4" | "rc4-56" | token auth-param = token "=" ( token | quoted-string )

member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out which is default).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is -1 (infinite).

The property only affects synchronous methods.
Minimal value is 500. Setting this to a value lower than 500 will set it to 500.

member.name: T:c_RZA
member.summary: MAC for SSL3 records and SSL3 Finished message
member.remarks:
The MAC is generated as: alg(K + pad_2 + alg(text + K + pad_1)) // Handshake Finished message MAC alg(K + pad_2 + alg(K + pad_1 + text)) // Record MAC where K is an n byte key
pad_1 is the character 0x36 repeated 48 times for MD5 or 40 times for SHA pad_2 is the character 0x5c repeated 48 times for MD5 or 40 times for SHA and text is the data being protected

member.name: T:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus
member.summary: Certificate validation status.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.TimeNotValid
member.summary: This certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain is not time valid.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.TimeNotNested
member.summary: Certificates in the chain are not properly time nested.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.Revoked
member.summary: Trust for this certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has been revoked.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.SignatureNotValid
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain does not have a valid signature.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.WrongUsage
member.summary: The certificate or certificate chain is not valid for its proposed usage.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.RootNotTrusted
member.summary: The certificate or certificate chain is based on an untrusted root.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.UnknownRev
member.summary: The revocation status of the certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain is unknown.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CyclicChain
member.summary: One of the certificates in the chain was issued by a certification authority that the original certificate had certified.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidExtension
member.summary: One of the certificates has an invalid extension.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidPolicyConstraints
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a policy constraints extension, and one of the issued certificates has a disallowed policy mapping extension or does not have a required issuance policies extension.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidBasicConstraints
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a basic constraints extension and either the certificate cannot be used to issue other certificates or the chain path length has been exceeded.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.InvalidNameConstraints
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has an invalid name constraints extension.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.UnsupportedNameConstraint
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a name constraints extension containing unsupported fields.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NotDefinedNameConstraint
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a name constraints extension and a name constraint is missing for one of the name choices in the end certificate.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NotPermittedNameConstraint
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a name constraints extension and there is not a permitted name constraint for one of the name choices in the end certificate.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.ExcludedNameConstraint
member.summary: The certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain has a name constraints extension and one of the name choices in the end certificate is explicitly excluded.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.IncompleteChain
member.summary: The certificate chain is not compete.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CtlTimeNotValid
member.summary: A CTL used to create this chain was not time valid.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CtlSignatureNotValid
member.summary: A CTL used to create this chain did not have a valid signature.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CtlWrongUsage
member.summary: A CTL used to create this chain is not valid for this usage.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.OfflineRev
member.summary: The revocation status of the certificate or one of the certificates in the certificate chain is either off-line or stale.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NoIssuanceChainPolicy
member.summary: The end certificate does not have any resultant issuance policies, and one of the issuing CA certificates has a policy constraints extension requiring it.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.UnknownError
member.summary: Unknown error.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.CNNotMatch
member.summary: The certificate's CN name does not match the passed value.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.MoreErrors
member.summary: There might be more errors apart from those reported.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.WeakAlgorithm
member.summary: Certificate uses algorithm which is not considered secure on this platform.

member.name: F:ComponentPro.Security.Certificates.CertificateVerificationStatus.NotTrusted
member.summary: Certificate is not trusted.

Even though it is possible to generate DSA keys and sign data using this class, but this process has not been optimized for speed and is very slow.

member.name: T:c_RGE
member.summary: Computes a Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) for the input data using the specified hash function.
member.remarks:
HMAC is defined by RFC 2104 and look like this: alg(K XOR opad + alg(K XOR ipad + text))
where alg is the base hash algorithm,
K is an n byte key,
ipad is the byte 0x36 repeated 64 times (or 128 times),
opad is the byte 0x5c repeated 64 times (or 128 times),
and text is the data being protected.

member.name: M:c_RGE.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HMAC class with the specified hash algorithm and key data.
member.param: A type of hash algorithm to use.

member.param: A type of hash algorithm to use. Must be a subclass of HashAlgorithm.

member.name: T:c_QAE
member.summary: Managed implementation of RSA algorithm.
member.p: The purpose of this class is to make it possible to verify signatures and encrypt data without the need to use CryptoAPI, which is not available in some scenarios.
Even though it is possible to generate RSA keys and sign data using this class, it is not recommended because the generated keys are not being checked to ensure they are strong primes.
